title: Panama Heads for a Trial in New York
sub_head: Former President Martinelli’s sons face extradition on charges of money laundering.
body:
A three-judge Panamanian court last week absolved former President Ricardo Martinelli of charges that he ordered the illegal wiretapping of some 150 citizens during his 2009-14 tenure. But with the imminent U.S. extradition from Guatemala of his two sons, who face money-laundering charges in Brooklyn, N.Y., federal court, Mr. Martinelli’s troubles may be far from over.
Mr. Martinelli’s legal issues at home and abroad are problems not only for the family. Both the wiretapping case and the Justice Department’s case threaten to cast a dark shadow over the rule of law in one of the Western Hemisphere’s most strategically important countries, and to damage its image as a destination for capital.
